search_results.title: Spiracle
search_results.lyrics:
Spiracle LyricsI want the parts of you
You only show to the corner of your bathroom mirror
I want the parts of your hand grenade heart
That beat slowly with anger and fear
I want the parts of you
You only show to the birds outside your bedroom window
I want the teeth that you lost as a child
That you hide in a box under your pillow

I want your quiet, your screaming and thrashing
The salt on your lips and the hands that God gave you
And I want your violence, your silent sedation
Your moon eyes, your telescope, morbid fixation
And I want your pyro, your born-again virgin
Your hands on my insides, your fingertips crawling
And I want your Jesus, your suicide mission
Your lips on the microphone, soft disposition
And I want your parties, the shark in your water
The scrapes on your knees and the blood that spills over
And I want your zeroes, your polluted marrow
The sweat on your palms and your surveillance shadow
I want your secrets, your clementine fields
The ropes that you climb up, the parts that won't heal
I want your safe word, your passive resistance
The sickness you foster, your favorite addictions
And I want your nightmares, the ghost in your doorway
Your paralyzed sleeping, your- (Aaaah)
I want you butterfly, I want you sailor
I am your lover and I am your jailorYou might also likeEmbed

description.plain: Spiracle, the first track of Flower Face’s album The shark in your water is a haunting yet powerful song depicting someone who wants everything about the person she loves, including the most twisted and somber parts of them. Through the reiteration of “i want” and the use of both soft and violent imagery in the lyrics, the singer deals with a deep yet unhealthy relationship.

song.embed_content: Read “Spiracle” by Flower Face on Genius
song.title: Spiracle

album.full_title: The Shark in Your Water by Flower Face
album.name: The Shark in Your Water

body.plain: Spiracle, the first track of Flower Face’s album The shark in your water is a haunting yet powerful song depicting someone who wants everything about the person she loves, including the most twisted and somber parts of them. Through the reiteration of “i want” and the use of both soft and violent imagery in the lyrics, the singer deals with a deep yet unhealthy relationship.

annotations: The shark in your water
This line is the title of the album the song is on, possibly meaning something violent or scary that hides under the surface.

I want the parts of you
 You only show to the corner of your bathroom mirror
The singer wants to know and love the parts of someone that they haven’t shown to any other person before.
I want your safe word
A reference to BDSM, where sometimes when violent or uncomfortable situations are played out there will be a ‘safe word’ so that the other person will know when to stop.
And I want your Jesus, your suicide mission
This may refer to the fact that, according to tradition, Jesus willingly gave himself over to the Romans without fighting, knowing that they would kill him. Sort of an assisted suicide.
Your moon eyes, your telescope, morbid fixation

Flower face has already used galaxy imagery to describe eyes in some of her other songs as a way to talk about the effects of drugs. It might mean that she deeply wants her lover even when they are in a state of severe drug addiction.

I want the teeth that you lost as a child
 That you hide in a box under your pillow
The image of the teeth the person lost as a child is tied to Flower face’s previous album in which the song Baby teeth uses baby teeth as a metaphor for first love and lost innocence.

search_results.title: Cornflower Blue
search_results.lyrics:
Cornflower Blue LyricsI want to lay on the kitchen floor with you
I want to do all the things that lovers do
Bruised on your face like a watercolour bloom
Moonlight paints your skin cornflower blue

You love me 'til you wear me out, then you love me more
I'm blue to the middle just like you, freezing to the core
The days, they fly like trains go by when I'm on my way home to you
And I think about if they ran me down, baby, what would you do?

I want to lay on the train tracks with you
I want to tie you down the way that lovers do
In the morning, I'll love the mangled bits of you
I'll love you when your lips turn cornflower blue
I love you 'til I wear you out, then I love you more
Now all the things that we don't talk about are waiting at the door
I won't let you out of my sight, even when you're sleeping
So baby, take your medicine and promise me you're eating

Who will I say goodnight to when you're gone?You might also like1Embed

description.plain:
“Cornflower Blue” was the first single to be released out of Flower Face’s 2022 album The Shark in Your Water.
McKinnon has told Alternative Press that

‘Cornflower Blue’ is about loving, or being loved, to the point of exhaustion; when it becomes a consuming obsession rather than a pure, comfortable love

song.embed_content: Read “Cornflower Blue” by Flower Face on Genius
song.title: Cornflower Blue

album.full_title: The Shark in Your Water by Flower Face
album.name: The Shark in Your Water

body.plain:
“Cornflower Blue” was the first single to be released out of Flower Face’s 2022 album The Shark in Your Water.
McKinnon has told Alternative Press that

‘Cornflower Blue’ is about loving, or being loved, to the point of exhaustion; when it becomes a consuming obsession rather than a pure, comfortable love

annotations: So baby, take your medicine and promise me you’re eating

she wants to make sure her lover is in a good condition for living, asking them to take medicine and promise to eat. (maybe something has happened before where the lover was skipping out on these key inclusions of life)
I want to tie you down the way that lovers do
the singer wants to tie her lover down on the tracks with her – perhaps symbolizing the singer wanting to die alongside said lover.
I love you ’til I wear you out, then I love you more
Jwjwjsjjakkqkqk

In the morning, I’ll love the mangled bits of you
 I’ll love you when your lips turn cornflower blue

these lines make me think the singer is talking about their partner’s possible insecurities, they could be talking about their total devotion to their partner, how they’ll love them no matter what. It could be interpreted in a romantic way, or possibly an unhealthy way. Either way these lines give me the impression the singer loves this person despite their flaws, and they possibly can already see those flaws coming to light, as a previous line the singer talks about how the moonlight painting the person they love’s skin cornflower blue, which is seen as more temporary than it turning cornflower blue. These lines could be about how even when everything’s gone horribly they’ll still love them (the mangled bits, which weren’t previously referenced, so that line is possibly about loving the person regardless of what happens) and loving someone despite the fact you know it’s going to be doomed in the first place and you can already see what kind of person they may become/ what may happen to them (the lips turning cornflower blue)
I want to lay on the train tracks with you

(this line could be a callback to the previous line about being ran down by the trains) it could be about wanting to confront death with this person, either in a romantic way (similar to wedding vows, how people promise till death do them part) or in a way where the singer could be alluding to a relationship where one of them is doomed to leave or die, so perhaps its a line about confronting death earlier together in a more peaceful way, before it’s inevitable. Laying on the train tracks to get run over and face death together in a more peaceful way, similar to the singer’s previous fantasies (laying on the kitchen floor.) ((please feel free to edit this if you think i am wrong, as i am not completely sure and id love to hear other peoples interpretations of the song!))

description.plain: Flower Face describes a relationship where her lover is slowly replacing all of her thoughts as they constantly try to convince her that she deserves the pain they are inflicting to her.

song.embed_content: Read “Maybe” by Flower Face on Genius
song.title: Maybe

album.full_title: The Shark in Your Water by Flower Face
album.name: The Shark in Your Water

body.plain: Flower Face describes a relationship where her lover is slowly replacing all of her thoughts as they constantly try to convince her that she deserves the pain they are inflicting to her.

annotations: My trigger finger twitches every time I hear your name
The trigger analogy can directly be assimilated to a trauma response : the only mention of her lover’s name deeply scares the singer

There’s something dark inside me and I can’t get it out
 My thoughts ring in your voice now and I can’t make a sound

Every thought the singer has is being replaced by the darkness and pain she assimilates to her lover. Usually, in romantic relationships, thinking about the one you love is supposed to bring positive feelings but the singer is too dependant to leave the abusive person.

song.embed_content: Read “Angela” by Flower Face on Genius
song.title: Angela

annotations: A car full of raccoons, I think that I’m crazy

The song is set in Montreal, where one of the the staple spots is a lookout on a mountain. While it offers beautiful views of the city, it is infested with racoons, thus the line “the car full of racoons”.

search_results.title: Kaleidoscope
search_results.lyrics:
Kaleidoscope Lyrics[Verse 1]
Every day, you're digging at the cavity
Sinking to the bottom of the pool
The doctor said your shame is eating everything
But when you're in love, you get so cruel
When you're alone, it's all you think about
Pulling little bugs out of your skin
Crack open your skull, you are an embryo
And you can eat yourself again

[Chorus 1]
Plastic dripping through the feeding wire
Liquid metals in your blood
Hard to keep sleeping when the room's on fire
They're cutting deeper than they should
Tried to call her from the southbound train
Thought you were headed somewhere new
But you wake up on the floor again
The concrete pouring out of you
[Verse 2]
Now every night you are a scientist
Stirring up your blood until it's clean
Fill yourself with fantasy and Klonopin
It's why you keep on dying in your dreams
Something's just been fucking with your chemicals
You can see your halo in the mirror
Paralyzed in sleep, you are the alchemist
She's on her back a thousand miles from here

[Chorus 2]
Want to be hunted like an animal
Feel yourself torn between her teeth
Your black eyes bloom in the kaleidoscope
The spinning colors make you weak
Cocaine left holes in the occipital
Your starry eyes are burning out
Dig your grave and lie down quietly
There's nowhere left to go but downYou might also likeEmbed

description.plain: “Kaleidoscope” details a surrealist slippage into insanity, in which the speaker “wants to be hunted like an animal” and “pulls little bugs out of your skin”

song.embed_content: Read “Kaleidoscope” by Flower Face on Genius
song.title: Kaleidoscope

body.plain: “Kaleidoscope” details a surrealist slippage into insanity, in which the speaker “wants to be hunted like an animal” and “pulls little bugs out of your skin”

annotations: The doctor said your shame is eating everything
Might be related to food shaming and eating disorders.
Liquid metals in your blood
Lithium is used as a mood stabiliser.  It comes as regular tablets or slow-release tablets (lithium carbonate). It also comes as a liquid that you swallow (lithium citrate).
Every day, you’re digging at the cavity

A cavity is an empty space in a solid object, most likely the protagonist’s mind. The cavity being a representation of their insanity, the ‘digging’ is them worsening their own state and ultimately losing their mind to the cavity altogether.

Thought you were headed somewhere new
 But you wake up on the floor again

No matter how they try to escape their state, they cannot. They call ‘her’ to let her know they are getting better somewhere new, but inevitably end up on the floor there. The location changes but their circumstance doesn’t.
Pulling little bugs out of your skin
Their condition is making them have hallucinations, furthering their descent into insanity.
Occipital
The occipital lobe, located at the back of the brain, is responsible for vision and image processing.
Klonopin
Klonopin, also known as clonazepam, is a medication commonly used to prevent and control seizures.

search_results.title: Baby Teeth
search_results.lyrics:
Baby Teeth Lyrics[Verse 1]
Your cheap drink tricks and cigarettes keep you locked inside a cage
Your mother fears you, your father can't hear you, you're money, a voice on a stage
I still ache from the night that you dragged me, kicking and screaming, out the door
But I won't let go, no, I left my baby teeth in your drawer

[Chorus]
If I can't hold you like a lover I won't hold you at all
The tide is turning on you, baby, and I feel nothing anymore
If we could stay this way forever would it ever be enough?
I wear your bruises on my shoulder now forever and evermore
[Verse 2]
Your lip got split, spill grenadine kisses, the codeine kids got you down
Picking fights with the devil, you know, you've got a real smart mouth
Driving you home from the bar and you're touching my face but I don't make a sound
Lost your baby teeth in the back seat, said somebody knocked them out

[Chorus]
If I can't hold you like a lover I won't hold you at all
If I don't pull myself together this could be the end of it all
I hear your voice inside the tv telling me to follow you home
I taste your teardrops on my tongue at night and it still turns me on

[Verse 3]
There are things that we will never say, but we know, we know
Even baby teeth will hurt you when I'm biting down

[Chorus]
If I can't hold you like a lover I won't hold you at all
The tide is turning on you, baby, and I feel nothing anymore
We could have stayed this way forever but it would never be enough
I wear your ache inside my heart, my dear, forever and evermoreYou might also like6Embed

description.plain: “Baby Teeth” is a song that I interpret as a girl singing about her abusive relationship. The girl refuses to give up on them at first, because she gave them her innocence (baby teeth). Eventually, she realizes that their relationship isn’t good for her and ends it, because as the song says, “it would never be enough.”

song.embed_content: Read “Baby Teeth” by Flower Face on Genius
song.title: Baby Teeth

body.plain: “Baby Teeth” is a song that I interpret as a girl singing about her abusive relationship. The girl refuses to give up on them at first, because she gave them her innocence (baby teeth). Eventually, she realizes that their relationship isn’t good for her and ends it, because as the song says, “it would never be enough.”

annotations: Lost your baby teeth in the back seat, said somebody knocked them out

as it has been confirmed that “baby teeth” is a metaphor for first love, this likely means first love in a more literal sense. losing your virginity in the back seat of the car, but “said somebody knocked them out” could either mean that it was not entirely consensual, or this person does not want to admit who they lost their virginity to, simply naming them as “somebody"
But I won’t let go, no, I left my baby teeth in your drawer
In an interview with AM800 Hear and Now, Ruby revealed that “Baby Teeth” is a metaphor for first love.

song.full_title: April to Death by Flower Face
song.title: April to Death

annotatable.link_title: April to Death by Flower Face
annotatable.title: April to Death

annotations: Nose bleeds like an afterthought

This line might imply that so many thing are going wrong with her life, that a nosebleed is nothing but an afterthought and can’t be important to the narrator out of neccessity.

It might also have to do with not being able to feel a nosebleed due to her face being numb, possibly from drugs, as morphine [which was mentioned early in the song in the line “But my hand have still got the morphine shakes”] can cause numbness.
I’m still written in his arm
He got a tattoo of her name

Lightning in our fingertips today
 I jump each time you touch me
Can’t touch each other, drugs? She’s been so freaked by these men she cant even warm up to another man anymore. He’s violent, hits her alot, everytime he lays his hands on her she gets a fright.

Soft skin press cold hands sleep sweet sleep gentle
 Hey, baby, are you okay? you’re always on my mind
 Coffee stains, radio static, slice my collarbones
 I love a boy who’s made of gold
 I love a boy with curly hair and river eyes

All the previous statements in the the song refer to him being a violent abusive man, maybe this verse refers to her ‘dream boy’… even the fact she calls him a boy could mean shes way younger than all the men she runs around with.

I don’t love any of these men
 Just want to feel the most I can
using men as a way to feel something close to love, no matter how violent or abusive they are towards her.

He’s a violent man and his heart’s decayed
 He’s a liar but I just can’t stay away
Essentially she’s in an abusive relationship and acknowledges that her lover is a bad guy.
But my hands have still got the morphine shakes
Her lover probably got her addicted to morphine and she’s currently coming down from her high.
Three bullets in a wedding dress

Taken literally, the speaker discloses that she thinks her lover will kill her on their wedding day.

Metaphorically it could mean, that she thinks she’ll die violently or at least not naturally before ever being able to marry.
Saying “ha ha ha, we’re going straight to hell”

He sounds hysterical and resigned at the same time about this fact, saying that he knows that the life he’s leading isn’t a good one.
Whether he feels bad about „taking her down with him“ is unclear.
Felt it bad when he took those pills

This line strongly suggests that her lover is addicted to drugs.
While she‘s aware of that, it makes her feel somewhat uncomfortable.

description.plain:
Flower Face–AKA Ruby KcKinnon–displays her talent for beautiful vocals in this soft, dreamy pop soundscape. She outlines a sad situation that too many people get stuck in: totally dependent on a partner who doesn’t respect them.

About “Sugar Water”, she told Wonderland

This song is very different from anything I’ve released before. It’s a lot more pop-esque and upbeat. I wanted to make a music video that would match that because I’ve never had a song whose sound would match a really bright, fun video like this one. The idea for the video came to me when I was thinking about Dance Dance Revolution, which I had as a kid and played every day, as well as Karaoke Revolution, Rock Band, Guitar Hero, all those early 2000s music-based games. The song is about being so infatuated with someone so much that you ignore all the warning signs because it feels so fun and exciting. So I thought it would be cool to have me performing the song in this video game world where I’m failing miserably, but I don’t even realize it until the very end when it suddenly hits me all at once. Just like that kind of relationship.

song.embed_content: Read “Sugar Water” by Flower Face on Genius

album.full_title: The Shark in Your Water by Flower Face

annotations:
You like to treat me like a child, but that’s all right
 I kinda like it when you talk the way you do

Even though he is talking down to her like a child, he is still expressing a form of affection and love towards her, and therefore she still appreciates it. Since he is restrained with expressing tenderness towards her, she will take what she can get.

This also shows the leeway she gives him in their relationship, she acknowledges the disrespect towards her, but quickly reassures ‘but that’s all right’ and insists she likes the treatment.
Hanging round like a puppy ’til you let me in

She is dependent on him the way a dog would be, and also has the traits of a puppy: overly eager and loyal. This insinuates a very toxic, unbalanced relationship in which she almost feels subservient to him.
The word ‘puppy’ specifically also brings to mind the idea of ‘puppy love’, a naïve and hopeful stage of a relationship in which we idealise our partner. She may still be trapped in this ‘puppy love’ phase of seeing her partner with rose-tinted glasses despite his mistreatment of her.

Saw him in my dreams again
 He’s wiping down the fingerprints
 Press so hard I float up to the sky
She frequently has dreams about him going too far and killing her (‘I float up to the sky’) and then covering his tracks afterwards by removing his fingerprints from the crime scene
Feeds me sugar water just to keep me alive

He gives her affection very sparingly, he is just sweet enough with her to keep her in the relationship and in love.

She feels so reliant and addicted to this affection  that receiving even watered down doses of it is equated to keeping her ‘alive’.
